1 We’ve worked with preferred managers to ensure these are considered in mandate design and implementation, and will continue to track and monitor.

2 Carbon risk measures exposure to carbon intensive companies. It is based on MSCI Carbon Metrics and is calculated as the portfolio weighted average of issuer carbon intensity. Carbon intensity is the ratio of annual
Scope 1 and 2 carbon emissions to annual revenue. Carbon risk is categorised as very low (0 to <15), low (15 to <70), moderate (70 to <250), high (250 to <525), and very high (>=525).
